resources.string: This app was made by stack overflow society and a few more tutorials.

Starvation is a severe deficiency in caloric energy intake, below the level needed to maintain an organism\'s life. It is the most extreme form of malnutrition. In humans, prolonged starvation can cause permanent organ damage and eventually, death. Starved people have a body weight index (BMI) under 16.0. Starving patients can be treated, but this must be done cautiously to avoid refeeding syndrome.

An underweight person is a person whose body weight is considered too low to be healthy. Underweight people have a body weight index (BMI) of between 16.0 and 18.5 or a weight 15% to 20% below that normal for their age and height group. Treatment options are diet, exercise, appetite stimulants.
Everything is okay, don\'t eat too much, keep healthy diet and do some exercises

Being overweight or fat is having more body fat than is optimally healthy. Being overweight is especially common where food supplies are plentiful and lifestyles are sedentary. Overweight people have a body weight index (BMI) between 25.0 and 30.0. Treatment diet and physical exercise.

Obesity is a medical condition in which excess body fat has accumulated to an extent that it may have a negative effect on health.[1] People are generally considered obese when their body weight index (BMI), a measurement obtained by dividing a person\'s weight by the square of the person\'s height, is over 30. Treatment diet, physical exercise, bariatric surgery.
